entries.text: Olaf Alders provided his weekly report that was full of new items. You can now +1 Perl modules, use the public API of MetaCPAN and compete with other CPAN authors for fame.
entries.title: Nice progress in the development of MetaCPAN

entries.text: This edition of the quarterly release marks the end of era. The next release will be already using the 'New Object Model'.
entries.title: Rakudo Star 2011.07 released with 10%-30% improvement in compile and execution speed

entries.text: A 10 page whitepaper explaining what is the cloud and what are the benefits (e.g. pay as you go,  on demand infrastructure, no upfront investment). It compares Amazon EC2 and Rackspace the leaders in providing infrastructure and then introduces Cloud Foundry. Then you have to fill a form to read about Stackato.
entries.title: Whitepaper from ActiveState: Perl and Python in the Cloud

entries.text: Tom Eliaz reports on creating a DMG package of Padre for Leopard, Snow Leopard, and Lion. The result is not perfect but it is critical to get feedback from Mac users.
entries.title: Padre on OSX

entries.text: Tom Christiansen posted his Unicode Slides on PerlMonks and caused another lengthy discussion. Sometimes even on topic. The slides are long and good.
entries.title: OSCON Perl Unicode Slides

entries.text: Ricardo Signes (RJBS) has posted the slides of his 3 hour long Moose tutorial. I have not seen his talk but his slides are really good.
entries.title: Moose is Perl: A Guide to the New Revolution

entries.text: Dave Cross wrote an article for the Josetteorama of Josette Garcia. It is worth reading especially if you have never been to a YAPC. You still have 10 days do join us or can plan for another Perl event. See below.
entries.title: YAPC::Europe Preview

entries.text: Tadeusz Sosnierz (tadzik) reports about his project. This will bring integrated documentation to Perl 6. So your program will be able to tell for each object.WHY  it is there?
entries.title: GSoC - The Perl 6 podparser branch has landed

entries.text: koolgirl asked the opinion of the PerlMonks whether she should answer when not 100% sure in the correctness of the answer. There are some really good responses encouraging participation. Even for non-experts.
entries.title: To Answer, Or Not To Answer....

entries.text: David Golden wanted to create a list of most important packages that might do better if there was an Alien::* package providing them.
entries.title: What are your top binary library dependencies?
OSDC.fr - French Open Source Developers' Conference

header: You are busy churning out code or managing the developers. You care about Perl but don't have time to go through tens and hundreds of articles and blog posts every day. You want to keep an eye on the development of Perl without drowning in a sea of blog posts. You need someone to point out the most important news and articles in the Perl World.
Let me try to be your guide.
subject: Welcome to the Perl Weekly
